message_1: Suppose you want to encode the message "SECRET" using a Vigenere cipher with the keyword "MATH". What will be the resulting ciphertext? (Assume that the alphabets are numbered 0 to 25 and 'A' is represented by 0, 'B' by 1, 'C' by 2, and so on.)
message_2:
To encode the message "SECRET" using a Vigenere cipher with the keyword "MATH", we first need to repeat the keyword to match the length of the message. In this case, the keyword becomes "MATHMA".

Now, we will add the corresponding numerical values of the message and the keyword, modulo 26.

S (18) + M (12) = 30 % 26 = 4 (E)
E (4) + A (0) = 4 % 26 = 4 (E)
C (2) + T (19) = 21 % 26 = 21 (V)
R (17) + H (7) = 24 % 26 = 24 (Y)
E (4) + M (12) = 16 % 26 = 16 (Q)
T (19) + A (0) = 19 % 26 = 19 (T)

The resulting ciphertext is "EEVYQT".
